page.title: 16Summer Holidays
page.content: This year from our class{(Mrs {Wilson's) 8 people }have been or are going on holiday{abroad. 2 people}are putting their{car}on a{ferry. Four {people}are going{abroad by plane, Two {people}are going{abroad by coach. {Seventeen people}are going on holiday in{this country by car.}One person is not going on holiday at all.{By Emma {Nation & Julia Hayward}(age 8){******* We have 13 weeks and 4 days holidays a year. In our class (Mr. Walsh's) 17 people have been abroad, 13 have not. The{most popular}place this year is Wales (6 children). Next,{Devon (3).}2 children going abroad,{1 to France and {1 to Sweden. Cornwall (2), Isles of {Scilly (1), Yarmouth (2), Lands End {(1), Doncaster (1), Skegness (1), {Weston Super Mare (l)}by James McFarlane,Matthew Smith & Paul Essex all aged 9.
